title: Ticket #3016: blahp canceling of completed job causes a failure
description:
I managed to screwup a proxy, which caused the gridmanager to attempt to cancel the job after a failed renewal.

The job had already completed before the cancellation was attempted. In such a case, qdel has the following output:

Request invalid for state of job MSG=invalid state for job - COMPLETE 19.brian-test.unl.edu

This causes the job to go on hold; see below. I propose the gridmanager should either screen-scrape this particular error message or check the status after a failed cancel. 

[bbockelm@brian-test ~]$ condor_q -held


-- Submitter: brian-test.unl.edu : <129.93.239.174:45320> : brian-test.unl.edu
 ID       OWNER          HELD_SINCE  HOLD_REASON
[... removing other jobs ...]
25246.0   bbockelm        5/29 09:02 qdel: Request invalid for state of job MSG=invalid state for job - COMPLETE 19.brian-test.unl.edu

5 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 0 running, 5 held, 0 suspended
remarks:
2012-Jun-28 16:51:43 by jfrey:
Another possibility is to have the blahp's pbs_cancel.sh script detect the error message and report a successful removal.

2012-Jul-03 15:25:06 by tannenba:
Also important for Bosco work.
attachments:
• pbs_qdel.patch 808 bytes added by jfrey on 2012-Jun-28 22:02:44 UTC.
    Patch to blahp's pbs_cancel.sh that treats qdel errors about completed and non-existent jobs as successes.
check_ins:
2012-Aug-07 14:33   Check-in [32993]: blahp version history. #3133 #3016 #3057 #3067 #3157 #3181 (By Jaime Frey )
2012-Jul-03 18:08   Check-in [32593]: Blahp treats pbs qdel failures as success in some cases. #3016 PBS's qdel will return failure if the desired job isn't in the queue or is in the queue in complete status. These failures should be treated as a success. (By Jaime Frey )
creator: bbockelm
